Author: Gokul G
description:
1. The number of days more than the complete weeks during a given period is the number of odd days during that period. 

2. An ordinary year has 365 days i.e 52 weeks and 1 day.
The number of odd days in an ordinary year is 1.

3. A leap year has 366 days i.e. 52 weeks and 2 days.
The number of odd days in a leap year is 2.

4. Number of odd days in
Jan - 3
Feb  - 0/1 (1 in leap year)
Mar - 3
Apr  - 2
May - 3
Jun   - 2
Jul    - 3 
Aug - 3
Sep  - 2
Oct  - 3
Nov - 2
Dec  - 3

4. All years divisible by 4, except centuries, are leap years.
    Every fourth century is a leap year.
400,800,1200,1600 are leap years.
100,200 are ordinary years    

5. A calendar repeats after every 400 years.

6. Number of odd days in a century = 5
    Number of odd day in a leap century = 6

7. In an ordinary year, the following pairs of months begin on the same day
Jan, Oct
Feb, Mar, Nov
Apr, Jul
Sep, Dec

8. In a leap year, the following pairs of months begin on the same day.
Jan, Apr, Jul
Feb, Aug
Mar, Nov
Sep, Dec

100 years contain 76 ordinary years and 24 leap years.

= (76*1)+(24*2)
= 124
= (17*7)+5
= 5 odd days

options.detail:
No. of odd days in 100 years = 5
Last day of first century is Friday.

200 years 
(5*2) 10 odd days = 3 odd days
Last day of second century is Wednesday.

300 years
(5*3) 15 odd days = 1 odd day
Last day of third century is Monday.

400 years
(5*4)+1 = 21 odd days = 0 odd days
1 is added since 400 is a leap year while 100,200,300 are not.
Last day of fourth century is Sunday.

The cycle starts repeating again. Last day of 5th century-Friday and so on.

The last day of a century cannot be a Tuesday, Thursday or a Saturday

options.detail:
January has 31 days. If it started on Sunday, then it would have 5 Sundays, Mondays and Tuesdays.

But there are only 4 Sundays.

Hence, it started on a Monday. There would be 5 Mondays, Tuesdays and Wednesdays.

If it started on any other day, then the number of either Thursdays or Sundays would be 5.
